meanings.definition: Of or relating to aptitude or natural ability.
meanings.sent1: Her aptitudinal skills in math made her a top student in the class.
meanings.sent2: The young artist showed an aptitudinal talent for painting at a very early age.
meanings.sent3: Despite his aptitudinal knack for sports, he always tripped over his own feet.
meanings.sent4: Her aptitudinal gift for languages was like a key that unlocked new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The aptitudinal nature of his musical talent was evident in every note he played.

meanings.definition: Possessing or demonstrating aptitude or natural ability.
meanings.sent1: The aptitudinal student quickly grasped complex concepts in science class.
meanings.sent2: She was recognized for her aptitudinal leadership skills within the organization.
meanings.sent3: His aptitudinal ability to fix things always came in handy around the house.
meanings.sent4: The team's aptitudinal performance on the field led them to victory.
meanings.sent5: Her aptitudinal creativity shone through in every project she undertook.
